info.title: Housing Metrics API
info.description: The Parcl Labs API provides analytics on the U.S. housing market, including data on housing stock, sales, listings, rentals, investor activity, and market trends.

get.description: Gets weekly updated rolling counts of newly listed for sale properties, segmented into 7, 30, 60, and 90 day periods ending on a specified date, based on a given <parcl_id>.

parameters.name: parcl_id

schema.description: A unique id for a given geographic market in the Parcl Labs API. Parcl_ids are unique and independent of each other, without any hierarchical structure. For example, the parcl_id for Brooklyn, NY bears no relationship to the parcl_id for the New York Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA), even though Brooklyn is a part of the New York MSA.
schema.title: Parcl Id

parameters.description: A unique id for a given geographic market in the Parcl Labs API. Parcl_ids are unique and independent of each other, without any hierarchical structure. For example, the parcl_id for Brooklyn, NY bears no relationship to the parcl_id for the New York Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA), even though Brooklyn is a part of the New York MSA.

parameters.name: property_type

schema.description: The type of property the data is associated with. Allows for filtering based on property type.

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. This field represents the index date, which is the Monday following a complete data capture week that runs from Monday to Sunday. The index date serves as the anchor for aggregating and reporting the data collected during the preceding week (7 day) and also sets the reference point for the rolling aggregation periods of 30, 60, and 90 days ending on this date. For example, if data is captured from 2024-01-01 (Monday) to 2024-01-07 (Sunday), the index date will be 2024-01-08, the Monday immediately following the capture period . Data becomes available for access on the Thursday following the index date. If no data is returned for a specified index date, it signifies that no relevant events were recorded within the specified aggregation periods.

rolling_7_day.title: Rolling 7 Day
rolling_7_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 7 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period captures data from the previous Monday to Sunday. For example, if the index date is 2024-03-11 (a Monday), this aggregation period spans from 2024-03-04 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value indicates an absence of data during this period (equivalent to 0)

rolling_30_day.title: Rolling 30 Day
rolling_30_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 30 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a rolling monthly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-02-09 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_60_day.title: Rolling 60 Day
rolling_60_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 60 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period offers a two-month view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-01-11 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_90_day.title: Rolling 90 Day
rolling_90_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 90 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a quarterly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2023-12-12 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in format YYYY-MM-DD. Data reflects the full month indicated by the date (YYYY-MM-DD), with updates on the 15th of the following month to include all events from the previous month. For example, data for January ('2024-01-01') is available on February 15th to include January's events. On the 15th of each month, data is revised to incorporate any new events recorded for the specified month after the initial update, ensuring the most accurate reflection of events.

standard_deviation.description:
Represents the variability of housing event prices around the median price within a specific <parcl_id> for a given month. It is measured in the same unit as the event price (e.g., USD for sales and listings, USD per month for rentals)

NULL: indicates insufficient data to calculate the standard deviation. This occurs in scenarios where the standard deviation cannot be computed because there is only 1 observed price

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. This field represents the index date, which is the Monday following a complete data capture week that runs from Monday to Sunday. The index date serves as the anchor for aggregating and reporting the data collected during the preceding week (7 day) and also sets the reference point for the rolling aggregation periods of 30, 60, and 90 days ending on this date. For example, if data is captured from 2024-01-01 (Monday) to 2024-01-07 (Sunday), the index date will be 2024-01-08, the Monday immediately following the capture period . Data becomes available for access on the Thursday following the index date. If no data is returned for a specified index date, it signifies that no relevant events were recorded within the specified aggregation periods

rolling_7_day.title: Rolling 7 Day
rolling_7_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 7 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period captures data from the previous Monday to Sunday. For example, if the index date is 2024-03-11 (a Monday), this aggregation period spans from 2024-03-04 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value indicates an absence of data during this period (equivalent to 0)

rolling_30_day.title: Rolling 30 Day
rolling_30_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 30 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a rolling monthly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-02-09 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_60_day.title: Rolling 60 Day
rolling_60_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 60 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period offers a two-month view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-01-11 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_90_day.title: Rolling 90 Day
rolling_90_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 90 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a quarterly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2023-12-12 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

purchase_to_sale_ratio.title: Purchase To Sale Ratio
purchase_to_sale_ratio.description:
Investor purchase to sale ratio within a given month, calculated by dividing the number of investor purchases (acquisitions) by the number of investor sales (dispositions).

1.00: Equal numbers of purchases and sales, achieving a 1:1 balance

>1.00: More purchases than sales

<1.00: More sales than purchases

0: No purchases (numerator = 0)

NULL: No sales (denominator = 0)

parcl_id.title: Parcl Id
parcl_id.description: A unique id for a given geographic market in the Parcl Labs API. Parcl_ids are unique and independent of each other, without any hierarchical structure. country.title: Country
country.description: The country associated with the given <parcl_id>

geoid.title: Geoid
geoid.description: Specifies the Geographic Identifier (GEOID) used to filter search results. GEOIDs are unique codes assigned to various geographic entities by the U.S. Census Bureau, encompassing a wide range of geographic levels from states to census blocks

state_fips_code.title: State Fips Code
state_fips_code.description: Specifies the state within the United States used to filter search results, using the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) code for geographic identification

name.title: Name
name.description: The official name of the market associated with the given <parcl_id>

state_abbreviation.title: State Abbreviation
state_abbreviation.description: Specifies the state within the United States used to filter search results. This field is designed to help users focus their search within specific states, using standard state abbreviations

region.title: Region
region.description: Specifies the region of the United States used to filter search results. This field is designed to help users focus their search within specific large geographic areas, aligning with common federal statistical divisions

location_type.title: Location Type
location_type.description: Specifies the type of geographic boundary used to filter search results. This field allows users to narrow down search results to specific geographic levels

total_population.title: Total Population
total_population.description: The total number of individuals residing within the geographic area identified by the parcl_id. This value is an integer that reflects the latest population count available from relevant census data

median_income.title: Median Income
median_income.description: The median income level of households within the geographic area identified by the parcl_id. This value is an integer representing the latest median household income available from relevant census data

parcl_exchange_market.title: Parcl Exchange Market
parcl_exchange_market.description: Specifies whether the geographic area identified by the parcl_id is available as a tradable real estate market on the Parcl Protocol trading platform. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates that the market is active for trading, while 0 indicates it is not

pricefeed_market.title: Pricefeed Market
pricefeed_market.description: Specifies whether a Parcl Labs price feed is available for the geographic area identified by the <parcl_id>. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates that a price feed is active for that market, while 0 indicates that it is not

case_shiller_10_market.title: Case Shiller 10 Market
case_shiller_10_market.description: Specifies whether the geographic area identified by the parcl_id is included in the Case-Shiller 10 index, which tracks the performance of residential real estate in 10 major metropolitan areas in the United States. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates inclusion in the index, while 0 indicates it is not included

case_shiller_20_market.title: Case Shiller 20 Market
case_shiller_20_market.description: Specifies whether the geographic area identified by the parcl_id is included in the Case-Shiller 20 index, which tracks the performance of residential real estate in 20 major metropolitan areas in the United States. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates inclusion in the index, while 0 indicates it is not included

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. This field represents the index date, which is the Monday following a complete data capture week that runs from Monday to Sunday. The index date serves as the anchor for aggregating and reporting the data collected during the preceding week (7 day) and also sets the reference point for the rolling aggregation periods of 30, 60, and 90 days ending on this date. For example, if data is captured from 2024-01-01 (Monday) to 2024-01-07 (Sunday), the index date will be 2024-01-08, the Monday immediately following the capture period . Data becomes available for access on the Thursday following the index date. If no data is returned for a specified index date, it signifies that no relevant events were recorded within the specified aggregation periods

rolling_7_day.title: Rolling 7 Day
rolling_7_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 7 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period captures data from the previous Monday to Sunday. For example, if the index date is 2024-03-11 (a Monday), this aggregation period spans from 2024-03-04 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value indicates an absence of data during this period (equivalent to 0)

rolling_30_day.title: Rolling 30 Day
rolling_30_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 30 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a rolling monthly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-02-09 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_60_day.title: Rolling 60 Day
rolling_60_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 60 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period offers a two-month view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-01-11 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_90_day.title: Rolling 90 Day
rolling_90_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 90 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a quarterly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2023-12-12 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. This field represents the index date, which is the Monday following a complete data capture week that runs from Monday to Sunday. The index date serves as the anchor for aggregating and reporting the data collected during the preceding week (7 day) and also sets the reference point for the rolling aggregation periods of 30, 60, and 90 days ending on this date. For example, if data is captured from 2024-01-01 (Monday) to 2024-01-07 (Sunday), the index date will be 2024-01-08, the Monday immediately following the capture period . Data becomes available for access on the Thursday following the index date. If no data is returned for a specified index date, it signifies that no relevant events were recorded within the specified aggregation periods.

rolling_7_day.title: Rolling 7 Day
rolling_7_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 7 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period captures data from the previous Monday to Sunday. For example, if the index date is 2024-03-11 (a Monday), this aggregation period spans from 2024-03-04 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value indicates an absence of data during this period (equivalent to 0)

rolling_30_day.title: Rolling 30 Day
rolling_30_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 30 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a rolling monthly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-02-09 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_60_day.title: Rolling 60 Day
rolling_60_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 60 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period offers a two-month view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-01-11 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_90_day.title: Rolling 90 Day
rolling_90_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 90 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a quarterly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2023-12-12 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in format YYYY-MM-DD. Data reflects the full month indicated by the date (YYYY-MM-DD), with updates on the 15th of the following month to include all events from the previous month. For example, data for January ('2024-01-01') is available on February 15th to include January's events. On the 15th of each month, data is revised to incorporate any new events recorded for the specified month after the initial update, ensuring the most accurate reflection of events

pct_gross_yield.title: Pct Gross Yield
pct_gross_yield.description:
Percent gross yield within a given month, calculated by dividing the annual median rental income (monthly median new_rental_listing price  12) by the median new_listings_for_sale price, then multiplying by 100 to convert the result into a percentage

NULL: insufficient data

purchase_to_sale_ratio.title: Purchase To Sale Ratio
purchase_to_sale_ratio.description:
Investor purchase to sale ratio within a given month, calculated by dividing the number of investor purchases (acquisitions) by the number of investor sales (dispositions).

1.00: Equal numbers of purchases and sales, achieving a 1:1 balance

>1.00: More purchases than sales

<1.00: More sales than purchases

0: No purchases (numerator = 0)

NULL: No sales (denominator = 0)

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. This field represents the index date, which is the Monday following a complete data capture week that runs from Monday to Sunday. The index date serves as the anchor for aggregating and reporting the data collected during the preceding week (7 day) and also sets the reference point for the rolling aggregation periods of 30, 60, and 90 days ending on this date. For example, if data is captured from 2024-01-01 (Monday) to 2024-01-07 (Sunday), the index date will be 2024-01-08, the Monday immediately following the capture period . Data becomes available for access on the Thursday following the index date. If no data is returned for a specified index date, it signifies that no relevant events were recorded within the specified aggregation periods.

rolling_7_day.title: Rolling 7 Day
rolling_7_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 7 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period captures data from the previous Monday to Sunday. For example, if the index date is 2024-03-11 (a Monday), this aggregation period spans from 2024-03-04 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value indicates an absence of data during this period (equivalent to 0)

rolling_30_day.title: Rolling 30 Day
rolling_30_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 30 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a rolling monthly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-02-09 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_60_day.title: Rolling 60 Day
rolling_60_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 60 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period offers a two-month view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-01-11 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_90_day.title: Rolling 90 Day
rolling_90_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 90 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a quarterly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2023-12-12 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in format YYYY-MM-DD. Data reflects the full month indicated by the date (YYYY-MM-DD), with updates on the 15th of the following month to include all events from the previous month. For example, data for January ('2024-01-01') is available on February 15th to include January's events. On the 15th of each month, data is revised to incorporate any new events recorded for the specified month after the initial update, ensuring the most accurate reflection of events

pct_gross_yield.title: Pct Gross Yield
pct_gross_yield.description:
Percent gross yield within a given month, calculated by dividing the annual median rental income (monthly median new_rental_listing price  12) by the median new_listings_for_sale price, then multiplying by 100 to convert the result into a percentage

NULL: insufficient data

purchase_to_sale_ratio.title: Purchase To Sale Ratio
purchase_to_sale_ratio.description:
Investor purchase to sale ratio within a given month, calculated by dividing the number of investor purchases (acquisitions) by the number of investor sales (dispositions).

1.00: Equal numbers of purchases and sales, achieving a 1:1 balance

>1.00: More purchases than sales

<1.00: More sales than purchases

0: No purchases (numerator = 0)

NULL: No sales (denominator = 0)

For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-01-11 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_90_day.title: Rolling 90 Day
rolling_90_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 90 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a quarterly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2023-12-12 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

pct_sf_for_rent_market.description: Percentage share of the total market for newly listed for rent single family properties that are investor-owned, segmented by portfolio size

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in format YYYY-MM-DD. Data reflects the full month indicated by the date (YYYY-MM-DD), with updates on the 15th of the following month to include all events from the previous month. For example, data for January ('2024-01-01') is available on February 15th to include January's events. On the 15th of each month, data is revised to incorporate any new events recorded for the specified month after the initial update, ensuring the most accurate reflection of events

rental_units.title: Rental Units
rental_units.description: Total number of units considered a rental, inferred from ownership and rental market activity, within a specified <parcl_id>

total_units.title: Total Units
total_units.description: Total number of single_family, townhouse, condo, and other non-land units within a specified <parcl_id>

pct_rental_concentration.title: Pct Rental Concentration
pct_rental_concentration.description: Percentage of total housing units that are considered rental units within a given month, calculated by dividing the number of rental_units by the total_units, then multiplying by 100 to convert this number into a percentage. This metric estimates the rental concentration within a specified <parcl_id> and may potentially overestimate the actual figure

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. This field represents the index date, which is the Monday following a complete data capture week that runs from Monday to Sunday. The index date serves as the anchor for aggregating and reporting the data collected during the preceding week (7 day) and also sets the reference point for the rolling aggregation periods of 30, 60, and 90 days ending on this date. For example, if data is captured from 2024-01-01 (Monday) to 2024-01-07 (Sunday), the index date will be 2024-01-08, the Monday immediately following the capture period . Data becomes available for access on the Thursday following the index date. If no data is returned for a specified index date, it signifies that no relevant events were recorded within the specified aggregation periods

rolling_7_day.title: Rolling 7 Day
rolling_7_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 7 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period captures data from the previous Monday to Sunday. For example, if the index date is 2024-03-11 (a Monday), this aggregation period spans from 2024-03-04 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value indicates an absence of data during this period (equivalent to 0)

rolling_30_day.title: Rolling 30 Day
rolling_30_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 30 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a rolling monthly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-02-09 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_60_day.title: Rolling 60 Day
rolling_60_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 60 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period offers a two-month view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-01-11 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_90_day.title: Rolling 90 Day
rolling_90_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 90 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a quarterly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2023-12-12 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

parcl_id.title: Parcl Id
parcl_id.description: A unique id for a given geographic market in the Parcl Labs API. Parcl_ids are unique and independent of each other, without any hierarchical structure. For example, the parcl_id for Brooklyn, NY bears no relationship to the parcl_id for the New York Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA), even though Brooklyn is a part of the New York MSA

country.title: Country
country.description: The country associated with the given <parcl_id>

geoid.title: Geoid
geoid.description: Specifies the Geographic Identifier (GEOID) used to filter search results. GEOIDs are unique codes assigned to various geographic entities by the U.S. Census Bureau, encompassing a wide range of geographic levels from states to census blocks

state_fips_code.title: State Fips Code
state_fips_code.description: Specifies the state within the United States used to filter search results, using the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) code for geographic identification

name.title: Name
name.description: The official name of the market associated with the given <parcl_id>

state_abbreviation.title: State Abbreviation
state_abbreviation.description: Specifies the state within the United States used to filter search results. This field is designed to help users focus their search within specific states, using standard state abbreviations

region.title: Region
region.description: Specifies the region of the United States used to filter search results. This field is designed to help users focus their search within specific large geographic areas, aligning with common federal statistical divisions

location_type.title: Location Type
location_type.description: Specifies the type of geographic boundary used to filter search results. This field allows users to narrow down search results to specific geographic levels

total_population.title: Total Population
total_population.description: The total number of individuals residing within the geographic area identified by the parcl_id. This value is an integer that reflects the latest population count available from relevant census data

median_income.title: Median Income
median_income.description: The median income level of households within the geographic area identified by the parcl_id. This value is an integer representing the latest median household income available from relevant census data

parcl_exchange_market.title: Parcl Exchange Market
parcl_exchange_market.description: Specifies whether the geographic area identified by the parcl_id is available as a tradable real estate market on the Parcl Protocol trading platform. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates that the market is active for trading, while 0 indicates it is not

pricefeed_market.title: Pricefeed Market
pricefeed_market.description: Specifies whether a Parcl Labs price feed is available for the geographic area identified by the <parcl_id>. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates that a price feed is active for that market, while 0 indicates that it is not

case_shiller_10_market.title: Case Shiller 10 Market
case_shiller_10_market.description: Specifies whether the geographic area identified by the parcl_id is included in the Case-Shiller 10 index, which tracks the performance of residential real estate in 10 major metropolitan areas in the United States. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates inclusion in the index, while 0 indicates it is not included

case_shiller_20_market.title: Case Shiller 20 Market
case_shiller_20_market.description: Specifies whether the geographic area identified by the parcl_id is included in the Case-Shiller 20 index, which tracks the performance of residential real estate in 20 major metropolitan areas in the United States. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates inclusion in the index, while 0 indicates it is not included

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in format YYYY-MM-DD. The current year's output provides year-to-date data. For previous years, annual counts are linked to the first day of each respective year. For example, a response dated '2023-01-01' represents the housing stock as of the year 2023.

single_family.title: Single Family
single_family.description: Total number of single family homes within a specified <parcl_id>

condo.title: Condo
condo.description: Total number of distinct condos within a specified <parcl_id>

townhouse.title: Townhouse
townhouse.description: Total number of distinct townhouses within a specified <parcl_id>

other.title: Other
other.description: Total number of units categorized as 'other' within a specified <parcl_id>. Examples of other units include co-ops and vacant land

all_properties.title: All Properties
all_properties.description: Total number of single family homes, condos, other, and townhouses within a specified <parcl_id>

date.title: Date
date.description: Date in format YYYY-MM-DD. Data reflects the full month indicated by the date (YYYY-MM-DD), with updates on the 15th of the following month to include all events from the previous month. On the 15th of each month, data is revised to incorporate any new events recorded for the specified month after the initial update, ensuring the most accurate reflection of events

acquisitions.title: Acquisitions
acquisitions.description: Total number of purchases of single family properties by investors, segmented by portfolio size, for the specified <parcl_id> within the given month

dispositions.title: Dispositions
dispositions.description: Total number of sales of single family properties by investors, segmented by portfolio size, for the specified <parcl_id> within the given month

new_listings_for_sale.title: New Listings For Sale
new_listings_for_sale.description: Total number of investor-owned, newly listed for sale single family properties, segmented by portfolio size, for the specified <parcl_id> within the given month

new_rental_listings.title: New Rental Listings
new_rental_listings.description: Total number of investor-owned, newly listed for rent single family properties, segmented by portfolio size, for the specified <parcl_id> within the given month

portfolio_10_to_99.description: Investors with a total of 10 to 99 units in their portfolio

rolling_7_day.title: Rolling 7 Day
rolling_7_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 7 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period captures data from the previous Monday to Sunday. For example, if the index date is 2024-03-11 (a Monday), this aggregation period spans from 2024-03-04 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value indicates an absence of data during this period (equivalent to 0)

If no data is returned for a specified index date, it signifies that no relevant events were recorded within the specified aggregation periods

rolling_7_day.title: Rolling 7 Day
rolling_7_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 7 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period captures data from the previous Monday to Sunday. For example, if the index date is 2024-03-11 (a Monday), this aggregation period spans from 2024-03-04 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value indicates an absence of data during this period (equivalent to 0)

rolling_30_day.title: Rolling 30 Day
rolling_30_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 30 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a rolling monthly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-02-09 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_60_day.title: Rolling 60 Day
rolling_60_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 60 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period offers a two-month view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2024-01-11 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

rolling_90_day.title: Rolling 90 Day
rolling_90_day.description: Aggregation period covers a 90 day period immediately preceding the index date. This period provides a quarterly view up to the Sunday before the index date. For example, with an index date of 2024-03-11, this aggregation period includes data from 2023-12-12 to 2024-03-10. A NULL value signifies no observed data within this timeframe (equivalent to 0)

parcl_id.title: Parcl Id
parcl_id.description: A unique id for a given geographic market in the Parcl Labs API. Parcl_ids are unique and independent of each other, without any hierarchical structure. For example, the parcl_id for Brooklyn, NY bears no relationship to the parcl_id for the New York Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA), even though Brooklyn is a part of the New York MSA

country.title: Country
country.description: The country associated with the given <parcl_id>

geoid.title: Geoid
geoid.description: Specifies the Geographic Identifier (GEOID) used to filter search results. GEOIDs are unique codes assigned to various geographic entities by the U.S. Census Bureau, encompassing a wide range of geographic levels from states to census blocks

state_fips_code.title: State Fips Code
state_fips_code.description: Specifies the state within the United States used to filter search results, using the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) code for geographic identification

name.title: Name
name.description: The official name of the market associated with the given <parcl_id>

state_abbreviation.title: State Abbreviation
state_abbreviation.description: Specifies the state within the United States used to filter search results. This field is designed to help users focus their search within specific states, using standard state abbreviations

region.title: Region
region.description: Specifies the region of the United States used to filter search results. This field is designed to help users focus their search within specific large geographic areas, aligning with common federal statistical divisions

location_type.title: Location Type
location_type.description: Specifies the type of geographic boundary used to filter search results. This field allows users to narrow down search results to specific geographic levels

total_population.title: Total Population
total_population.description: The total number of individuals residing within the geographic area identified by the parcl_id. This value is an integer that reflects the latest population count available from relevant census data

median_income.title: Median Income
median_income.description: The median income level of households within the geographic area identified by the parcl_id. This value is an integer representing the latest median household income available from relevant census data

parcl_exchange_market.title: Parcl Exchange Market
parcl_exchange_market.description: Specifies whether the geographic area identified by the parcl_id is available as a tradable real estate market on the Parcl Protocol trading platform. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates that the market is active for trading, while 0 indicates it is not

pricefeed_market.title: Pricefeed Market
pricefeed_market.description: Specifies whether a Parcl Labs price feed is available for the geographic area identified by the <parcl_id>. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates that a price feed is active for that market, while 0 indicates that it is not

case_shiller_10_market.title: Case Shiller 10 Market
case_shiller_10_market.description: Specifies whether the geographic area identified by the parcl_id is included in the Case-Shiller 10 index, which tracks the performance of residential real estate in 10 major metropolitan areas in the United States. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates inclusion in the index, while 0 indicates it is not included

case_shiller_20_market.title: Case Shiller 20 Market
case_shiller_20_market.description: Specifies whether the geographic area identified by the parcl_id is included in the Case-Shiller 20 index, which tracks the performance of residential real estate in 20 major metropolitan areas in the United States. It is a boolean value: 1 indicates inclusion in the index, while 0 indicates it is not included

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Search markets by keywords, geographic identifiers, or boundary types to retrieve market IDs (parcl_id)

tags.name: Market Metrics
tags.description: Get overall housing stock information, and analyze supply and price trends across sales, listings, and rentals for markets (parcl_id)

tags.name: Rental Market Metrics
tags.description: Get rental market analytics for markets (parcl_id)

tags.name: For Sale Market Metrics
tags.description: Get for sale listing analytics for markets (parcl_id)

tags.name: Investor Metrics
tags.description: Get analytics on overall investor ownership and transaction activity for markets (parcl_id)

tags.name: Portfolio Metrics
tags.description: Get analytics on investor ownership and transaction activity for single family homes in markets (parcl_id), segmented by the unit size of the investor's portfolio
